background_context.situation: Engaged member of a local community club
background_context.environment: Using a website to access club information and events
background_context.constraints: Frustration with outdated website design and navigation

goals_motivations.drives: Desire for a more engaging and user-friendly community website
achievements: Easily find and register for events
Improve self-service options for club administration

behaviors_patterns.current_work: Navigates the website to find events and community information
behaviors_patterns.habits: Regularly checks for events and community resources, but struggles with website usability

obstacles: Difficulty finding relevant events and information on the website
Limited self-service options for club members
pain_points_frustrations.what_doesnt_work: Current website design and navigation are not user-friendly or engaging

needs_desires.better_life: A modern, visually appealing website with easy navigation and accessible resources
looking_for: A community Q&A section for new residents

attitudes_beliefs.mental_models: Believes in the importance of community engagement and support
attitudes_beliefs.preferences: Favors user-friendly and aesthetically pleasing designs
attitudes_beliefs.values: Community involvement, accessibility, and ease of use

technical_comfort.tools: Currently using the club's website and possibly other community platforms
technical_comfort.technical_abilities: Comfortable with basic website navigation but desires improved functionality

quotes: "It just feels like an old person's home... it looks like a 20-year-old website."
"I think that the website needs to be warm and engaging..."
"...if there were an easy way for them to resolve those issues in the moment, I think it could increase satisfaction a lot."
